Life:Be-Born.Explanation: A BE-BORN Event occurs whenever a PERSON is born.

Life:Marry.Explanation: A MARRY Event occurs whenever two people marry.

Life:Divorce.Explanation: A DIVORCE Event occurs whenever two people divorce.

Life:Injure.Explanation: An INJURE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is physically harmed.

Life:Die.Explanation: A DIE Event occurs whenever a PERSON dies.

Movement:Transport.Explanation: A TRANSPORT Event occurs whenever an ARTIFACT or a PERSON is moved from one PLACE to another.

Transaction:Transfer-Ownership.Explanation: A TRANSFER-OWNERSHIP Event occurs whenever ownership of an ARTIFACT changes from one ENTITY to another.

Transaction:Transfer-Money.Explanation: A TRANSFER-MONEY Event occurs whenever money changes hands from one ENTITY to another.

Business:Start-Org.Explanation: A START-ORG Event occurs whenever an ORGANIZATION is established.

Business:Merge-Org.Explanation: A MERGE-ORG Event occurs whenever two ORGANIZATIONS merge.

Business:Declare-Bankruptcy.Explanation: A DECLARE-BANKRUPTCY Event occurs whenever an ORGANIZATION declares bankruptcy.

Business:End-Org.Explanation: An END-ORG Event occurs whenever an ORGANIZATION ceases to exist.

Conflict:Attack.Explanation: An ATTACK Event is defined as a violent physical act causing harm or damage.

Conflict:Demonstrate.Explanation: A DEMONSTRATE Event occurs whenever a large number of people come together in a public area to protest or demand some sort of official action.

Contact:Meet.Explanation: A MEET Event occurs whenever two or more entities come together for a purpose.

Contact:Phone-Write.Explanation: A PHONE-WRITE Event occurs whenever one entity contacts another by phone or in writing.

Personnel:Start-Position.Explanation: A START-POSITION Event occurs whenever a PERSON starts a new job or position.

Personnel:End-Position.Explanation: An END-POSITION Event occurs whenever a PERSON leaves a job or position.

Personnel:Nominate.Explanation: A NOMINATE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is formally suggested for a position.

Personnel:Elect.Explanation: An ELECT Event occurs whenever a PERSON is elected to a position.

Justice:Arrest-Jail.Explanation: An ARREST-JAIL Event occurs whenever a PERSON is taken into custody or imprisoned.

Justice:Release-Parole.Explanation: A RELEASE-PAROLE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is released from custody or granted parole.

Justice:Trial-Hearing.Explanation: A TRIAL-HEARING Event occurs whenever a legal trial or hearing takes place.

Justice:Charge-Indict.Explanation: A CHARGE-INDICT Event occurs whenever a PERSON is formally accused of a crime.

Justice:Sue.Explanation: A SUE Event occurs whenever a legal action is taken by one party against another.

Justice:Convict.Explanation: A CONVICT Event occurs whenever a PERSON is found guilty of a crime.

Justice:Sentence.Explanation: A SENTENCE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is given a punishment for a crime.

Justice:Fine.Explanation: A FINE Event occurs whenever a PERSON or ENTITY is ordered to pay money as a penalty.

Justice:Execute.Explanation: An EXECUTE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is put to death by the state.

Justice:Extradite.Explanation: An EXTRADITE Event occurs whenever a PERSON is transferred from one jurisdiction to another for legal purposes.

Justice:Acquit.Explanation: An ACQUIT Event occurs whenever a PERSON is found not guilty of a crime.

Justice:Appeal.Explanation: An APPEAL Event occurs whenever the decision of a court is taken to a higher court for review.

Justice:Pardon.Explanation: A PARDON Event occurs whenever a head-of-state or their appointed representative lifts a sentence imposed by the judiciary.

Adjudicator: An entity, usually a judge or legal body, that makes decisions or judgments in legal cases.
Agent: An entity that performs an action or causes an event to occur.
Artifact: An object or item that is involved in an event, such as a weapon or tool.
Attacker: An entity that carries out an attack.
Beneficiary: An entity that benefits from an action or event.
Buyer: An entity that purchases or acquires ownership of an artifact or service.
Communicator: An entity that sends a message or communicates information to another entity.
Crime: An illegal act or offense that is the subject of legal proceedings.
Defendant: An entity that is accused or charged in a legal proceeding.
Destination: The place to which an entity or artifact is being transported or moved.
Elector: An entity that has the authority to vote or elect someone to a position.
Entity: A general term for any person, organization, or object involved in an event.
Giver: An entity that provides or donates something to another entity.
Instrument: An object or tool used to carry out an action or event.
Money: Currency or financial assets involved in a transaction or event.
Nominator: An entity that proposes or nominates someone for a position or role.
Organization: A group or institution involved in an event, such as a company or government agency.
Organization1: The first organization involved in an event, typically used in the context of mergers or partnerships.
Organization2: The second organization involved in an event, typically used in the context of mergers or partnerships.
Origin: The starting point or source from which an entity or artifact is transported or moved.
Person: An individual human involved in an event.
Place: A location where an event occurs.
Plaintiff: An entity that initiates a legal action or lawsuit against another entity.
Position: A job title or role within an organization.
Price: The cost or value of an artifact or service in a transaction.
Prosecutor: An entity that brings charges against a defendant in a legal proceeding.
Recipient: An entity that receives something from another entity.
Seller: An entity that transfers ownership of an artifact or service to another entity in exchange for money or other compensation.
Sentence: The punishment assigned to a defendant who is found guilty in a legal proceeding.
Spouse: A person's husband or wife, involved in marriage-related events.
Target: An entity that is the focus or recipient of an action, such as an attack or criticism.
Time: The specific point or duration at which an event occurs.
Vehicle: A means of transportation used to move people or artifacts from one place to another.
Victim: An entity that suffers harm or damage as a result of an action or event.
